channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why has the world’s happiest country just plummeted in expat rankings?
item.description: Finland has been voted one of the worst places to live as an expat in 2024.

item.title: Taiwan under pressure to bolster defense amid Trump-Harris election race
item.description: Experts say that Taiwan is under more pressure to build up its defense capabilities and deterrence in the face of uncertainty in the upcoming U.S. elections.

item.title: Losses for U.S. stock futures deepen; Dow futures down more than 350 points
The untold story of how Exxon scored a $1 trillion oil bonanza that 30 rivals passed up
item.description: “When everyone else was pulling back, we were leaning in,” says Liam Mallon, president of Exxon’s production division.

item.title: Nikkei 225 falls more than 5%, hovering near bear market territory, as Asia-Pacific sell-off continues
item.description: Investors will look toward key trade data from China and Taiwan this week, as well as central bank decisions from Australia and India.

item.title: Japan’s Nikkei 225 index plunges 5% as global sell-offs resume
Goldman Sachs raises U.S. recession odds to 25% from 15%
item.description: “We continue to see recession risk as limited,” the Goldman economists led by Jan Hatzius said in a report to clients on Sunday.

item.title: These 10 stocks usually rise when Nvidia shares fall
item.description: While Nvidia tanked by nearly 12% last month, stocks identified by CNBC Pro rose by 9%.

item.title: Dow futures now down more than 300 points, Nasdaq-100 futures off 1.8%
Supreme Court justice blasts the increase in laws and regulations, defends Trump immunity ruling
item.description: “Here we have, for the first time in our history, one presidential administration bringing criminal charges against a prior president. It’s a grave question, right? Grave implications.”

item.title: Want to invest $50,000? Here are 5 ETFs to buy and hold, according to a wealth manager
item.description: Even professional investors use ETFs as a way to get "diversified and easy access to different geographies and themes," wealth manager Tariq Dennison says.

item.title: Recession fears rattle market. Can Wall Street’s ‘Great Rotation’ trade roll on?
Why did Warren Buffett dump Apple stock? He could be managing risk or raising cash to snap up bargains in a recession
item.description: Since 2016, when Warren Buffett first bought Apple, shares have soared almost 900%, delivering Berkshire billions of dollars worth of unrealized profits.

item.title: Elon Musk PAC being investigated by Michigan secretary of state for potential violations
item.description: A political action committee backed by Elon Musk is being investigated by the Michigan secretary of state's office amid efforts to collect voter data.

item.title: Stock market went from cheering ‘Goldilocks’ to fearing recession. What’s next?
